channel.title: Plumber recovers $78,000 diamond ring
channel.description:
[b]PHOENIX - Just a case of plumb luck.[/b] It took a plumber to retrieve a woman's 7-carat diamond ring after city workers failed in efforts to flush the gem out of the pipes of a restaurant toilet. The $78,000 engagement ring fell from Allison Berry's hand when she flushed the toilet in the restroom of the Black Bear Diner on Jan. 14. The ring plopped in and the water whisked it away, said Elena Castelar, the restaurant's shift manager. City workers opened a pipe outside the restaurant and continuously flushed the toilet, hoping to push the ring out to the opening. When that didn't work, the city called the office in suburban Tempe of Mr. Rooter, a plumbing services franchise based in Waco, Texas. "This is going to be like dredging for a treasure chest in the ocean," Mike Roberts, general manager of Mr. Rooter, said at the time. Roberts guided a tiny video camera into the pipe with an infrared light attached. He eventually spotted the ring just 3 feet down and 5 feet over from where it was flushed. Then it took an hour-and-a-half of jackhammering and pipe removal before Roberts and a technician could recover the ring, eight hours after it fell in the toilet. "They always say diamonds are a girl's best friend. In this case, a plumber is a girl's best friend," Roberts said. "She was just so excited, she had tears in her eyes. She gave us a hug and said 'Thank you so much.'" The Mr. Rooter bill came to $5,200 and the city's bill was $1,000. Berry, of Eureka, Calif., and her fiance also tipped Roberts and the technician $400 each and gave $200 to a diner employee for staying late.
sauce: http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/28829082/?GT1=43001 Wow. Use your other hand, woman.

item.title: Plumber recovers $78,000 diamond ring
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer

@Yz85Racer wrote:

Holy fuck. What a lucky bastard.

item.title: Plumber recovers $78,000 diamond ring
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Not X A Alex, post:4, topic:258516”][quote author=Scrubs link=topic=341366.msg2641872#msg2641872 date=1232928721]

The news is always fun with Uriko.

on-topic - Wow I wouldn’t have done that for a ring no matter how much it cost.

Is that a joke?
78k ring > 6k bill …why not? it’s not like the girl did anything. The plumber got 5.2k + free hug. Everyone wins.

[/quote]
For a women though, its just like I don’t want my hands covered in shit.[/quote]I don’t think a woman would ever give up a chance to recover a ring of… pretty much any value.
Girls are biologically programmed to be gold-diggers.

Read full topic

item.title: Plumber recovers $78,000 diamond ring

item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[b]PHOENIX - Just a case of plumb luck.[/b]

It took a plumber to retrieve a woman’s 7-carat diamond ring after city workers failed in efforts to flush the gem out of the pipes of a restaurant toilet.

The $78,000 engagement ring fell from Allison Berry’s hand when she flushed the toilet in the restroom of the Black Bear Diner on Jan. 14. The ring plopped in and the water whisked it away, said Elena Castelar, the restaurant’s shift manager.

City workers opened a pipe outside the restaurant and continuously flushed the toilet, hoping to push the ring out to the opening. When that didn’t work, the city called the office in suburban Tempe of Mr. Rooter, a plumbing services franchise based in Waco, Texas.

Then it took an hour-and-a-half of jackhammering and pipe removal before Roberts and a technician could recover the ring, eight hours after it fell in the toilet.

“They always say diamonds are a girl’s best friend. In this case, a plumber is a girl’s best friend,” Roberts said. “She was just so excited, she had tears in her eyes. She gave us a hug and said ‘Thank you so much.’”
